Name: Charles Montgomery

Border Force will protect our border with single immigration and customs checks, tackle smuggling, immigration crime and border tax fraud, and it will implement fast and fair decisions. This will be accomplished by integrating the work of the legacy immigration and customs services, coupled with the use of technology to increase the level of data and intelligence support to frontline operations. We will work collaboratively to achieve this with our partners and develop our special relationships with HMRC, the Police, SOCA and other law enforcement agencies.'

Name: Stephen Webb

Name: Bernard Silverman
Job/Team Function: 'The task of the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA) is to provide independent scientific advice and support of the highest quality to the Home Secretary and other Home Office ministers and officials on the whole range of Home Office policy and operations. Home Office specialists in many scientific disciplines work under the CSA's leadership: physical scientists and engineers; economists, social researchers and operational researchers; statisticians; and veterinary, medical and biological scientists. The Home Office CSA also plays a key role across government, for example in the interdepartmental network of departmental Chief Scientific Advisers, chaired by the Government Chief Scientific Adviser.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job Title: Director for Social Science and Chief Economist
Job/Team Function: 'The Chief Economist provides impartial, high-quality economic advice to Ministers and senior officials across the full range of Home Office policy areas. Working in the Strategic Centre of the Home Office, he is directly supported by a team of economists and operational researchers (the Economics and Resource Analysis group, or ERA). As Director for Social Science he is responsible for ensuring that the analysis undertaken by Home Office economists, operational reasearchers and social researchers, many of whom are embedded in policy areas, is conducted to the highest professional standards and used appropriately.'

Name: Alan Pratt
Job Title: Director of Science Engineering and Technology
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Science, Engineering and Technology and Chief Operating Officer provides strategic oversight of all Home Office physical science and technology. They also have direct management responsibility for science delivery and regulation functions, including the Centre for Applied Science and Technology (CAST), National DNA Database Unit (NDNADU), Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU), HO Science Shared Support team and sponsors the Forensics and Surveillance Camera Regulator. As Head of Profession for scientists and engineers in the Home Office, they work across Government to ensure specialist scientific skills are developed and used effectively.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: The Economic and Resource Analysis (ERA) group provides objective, scientific advice to support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, largely through specialist Economists and Operational Researchers.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy and Ministerial support on the use of living animals in scientific procedures and for the operation of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) in England, Scotland and Wales. Acting on the advice of the animals (scientific procedures) inspectorate (ASPI), the ASPD licensing team grants, amends and revokes licences granted under ASPA. The ASPD policy team supports ministers by providing advice on specific issues, speeches, briefing for meetings and parliamentary debates, and draft responses to parliamentary questions. In addition, the policy team deals with correspondence from MPs and the public about animal experimentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Senior Biometrics Adviser provides advice to those projects and programmes in the Home Office, its agencies and law enforcement organisations which make use of biometrics for identity assurance, securing of borders and the prevention and the investigation of crime – from development of policy to procurement and deployment. The SBA offers independent assurance on programme feasibility, risk management and value for money. The Adviser leads on national and international standards within the Home Office, and is the interface to the supplier, integrator and academic communities, ensuring a coherent forward view on the application of biometrics in a privacy-respecting context.'
Notes: Salary costs included in 1HOS02

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Statistician and Head of Profession for Statistics

The statistical teams work under the Chief Statistician who is also the Head of Profession for Statistics and he reports to the National Statistician with respect to all professional matters. The teams collect, process, analyse and publish a range of National Statistics and official statistics outputs. These support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, performance management, and meet the needs of Parliament and the wider public.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST)
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST) provides expert advice, innovation and frontline support for the Home Office and its agencies on any issue relating to science and technology. CAST supports the full range of Home Office priorities in the areas of policing and tackling crime, counter terrorism, border security and controlling immigration. CAST only operate where others cannot for reasons of impartiality, national security or market failure.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Animals in Science Regulation Unit
Job/Team Function: 'The Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU) comprises the policy, licensing and inspectorate staff responsible for administering the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) and related regulations.  The Policy Team advises ministers on issues related to ASPA and responds to correspondence (including PQs and FOI enquiries) from MPs and the public.  Inspectors (all registered medical or veterinary practitioners) provide advice on applications to the Licensing Team who grant the licences on behalf of the Secretary of State.  Inspectors also visit registered establishments to check for non-compliance and provide advice on applications and good practice. The majority of visits are unannounced.'

Job/Team Function: 'Home Office Criminal Investigation Teams are responsible for tackling immigration crime at the border and inland with a particular focus on organised immigration crime. They have a criminal and financial investigations capability, combining crime teams at the border and in regional offices across the UK using specially trained immigration officers, financial investigators and seconded police officers to disrupt organised criminal groups. By working in an integrated way with law enforcement agencies at home and abroad, particularly the National Crime Agency, Border Police Command, we will maximise our strengths and develop our capability to deal with the full range of immigration offences. Our priorities are to tackle all forms of human trafficking, facilitation and the production and supply of false or forged documentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the deportation of Foreign National Offenders from the United Kingdom.  The Directorate’s objective is to protect the public by deporting foreign nationals who commit serious criminal offences, where legislation permits, and to actively monitor and manage Foreign National Offenders (FNOs) released into the community pending deportation. It does this by rigorously pursuing deportation against foreign offenders who meet our criteria, managing each case through the legal process, negotiating barriers such as travel documents and ensuring that the use of immigration detention is appropriate. Asylum, remand; custody and non-detained teams provide specialist service to these key cohorts. A further 90 IE staff are embedded in prisons nationwide.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading a programme of work on removals integration. The work involves exploring new ways of working and alternative delivery models to increase capacity and capability and deliver efficiencies in the longer term.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the removal of cases detained by the Immigration Compliance & Enforcement Teams across the Country.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Working with partners within the Home Office and other government departments, the Director of the Interventions and Sanctions Unit is responsible for the development and systematic application of a range of sanctions in order to deny access to public and financial services by those who are not entitled, thereby removing incentives for people to stay in the UK illegally and encouraging those who remain here unlawfully to regularise their stay or to depart voluntarily.

Name: David Wood
Job/Team Function: The Director of Crime and Intelligence has primary responsibility for frontline immigration intelligence, criminal investigation and criminal casework, including the deportation of foreign offenders ensuring that those who have no right to be in the UK do not remain

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for professional standards of operational intelligence in IE; intelligence policy, guidance, compliance and provision of intelligence training; liaison with UK law enforcement; advice on document fraud and forgery trends, in-depth forensic examination of suspect documents and provision of document fraud and forgery training

Name: Mike Anderson
Job Title: Director General, International and Immigration Policy Group
Job/Team Function: 'Strategy, Immigration and International Group gives policy advice on immigration and border policy, civil liberties and identity and sponsors the key agencies in the Home Office and NDPBs which safeguard and regulate personal information including the Identity and Passport Service and the Criminal Records Bureau. The Group leads on strategy development for the Department and coordinates across the Home Office on its international agenda. The Director General is a member of the Home Office Executive Management Board and Supervisory Board.'

Name: Tyson Hepple
Job/Team Function: 'Cross-Home Office responsibility for delivering our objective to Protect People's Freedoms and Civil Liberties and policy responsibility for key parts of the civil liberties and public protection agenda including but not limited to DNA retention; CCTV and the Automatic Number Plate Recognition System, Stop and Search. Also responsible for implementing the outcome of the review of the Vetting and Barring Scheme, the criminal records regime, for managing the extradition review and for the passage of the Rights and Freedoms Bill. The Directorate sponsors the Independent Police Complaints Commission; the Security Industry Authority; the Independent Safeguarding Authority; the Criminal Records Bureau.'

Name: Peter Storr
Job/Team Function: 'The International Director heads the Directorate which delivers the European Union and wider international aspects of Home Office priorities, with its international partners. The Directorate works closely with many Home Office units and agencies, and with other government departments and posts overseas to ensure that the Home Office’s international priorities are identified and coherently managed, negotiated and delivered.'

Name: Glyn Williams
Job Title: Director of Immigration and Border Policy Directorate
Job/Team Function: 'Provide effective policy advice to support the government’s objective of reducing net migration; Provide a strategic policy framework to protect the UK from illegal immigration, crime and terrorism, through effective end-to end border controls; Provide an effective set of policies that protect the public by removing illegal immigrants, deporting foreign national criminals and denying the privileges of British nationality to those who harm the UK; Support an effective asylum system, through effective policies, both in the UK and in Europe; Ensure we have a fit for purpose legal framework, and manage litigation effectively'

Name: Kenny Bowie
Job/Team Function: 'The Judicial Cooperation unit is responsible for extradition policy and casework and for overseeing the review of our extradition obligations. The UK Central Authority within JCU is responsible of administering the UK’s obligations under the current Mutual Legal Assistance scheme and negotiating the European Investigation Order.'

Job/Team Function: At any one time the Home Office has around 60 smaller ICT projects which are outside of the major programmes established within individual business areas. This post is responsible for overseeing these projects and ensuring that they are delivered to time, quality and budget and that technology effectively supports and enables business change
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: 'Post eliminated'
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: The Architecture Team develops and owns the Home Office Enterprise Architecture Framework. This maximises value from information and communications technology (ICT). It creates strategic architecture across the Home Office Group by highlighting dependencies between systems and information flows and developing guidance, tools and frameworks to improve corporate effectiveness of ICT for use in major programmes and business as usual. It helps the Department manage and use the Framework and sets associated technical standards and policies. This helps the HO drive up quality and drive down cost. It provides assurance, advice and briefings to the Chief Information Officer and governance boards.'
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: Eliminated
Job Title: Head of IT Strategy and Portfolio
Job/Team Function: The team assures the delivery and realisation of benefits from the Home Office portfolio of major projects. Linking together the delivery of projects to the implementation of the Home Office IT strategy which the team is responsible for defining and managing. This team also act as the gateway for projects that qualify to go through the Cabinet Office spending control process, keeping Home Office IT activities aligned with Government IT strategy and provide portfolio management of all the projects delivered by the Home Office IT function.
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: The Police National Computer Services Directorate was established on the 1st October 2012 when staff that previously worked for the National Policing Improvement Agency were transferred into the Home Office. The Directorate provides critical national systems, which includes the Police National Computer and the DNA Database used by the police, other law enforcement agencies and other government departments. This Directorate also manages the Airwave digital radio service which provides secure voice communications to all three emergency blue light services.
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: The Home Office Shared Services Directorate provides shared services for estates, IT, information management and shared business services for finance, HR and procurement across the Home Office and to some other government departments. The Directorate manages expenditure of around £400m annually across the Home Office, with services largely delivered through third party suppliers.'
Notes: Eliminated with the creation of Corporate Services in November 2013

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Operational Assurance Directorate will provide objective second line assurance of Border Force operational activity through the development and implementation of new assurance standards and a risk-based assurance and testing regime. It will act as the central point of contact within Border Force for Home Office and external audit and assurance teams. Central oversight and consolidation within Border Force of third party review/inspection recommendations will inform the operational response and ensure that there is progress to deliver continuous improvement. Co-ordination of assurance and audit activity including outcomes from border security testing programmes and from the analysis of internal and external reviews will serve to identify cross Border Force risks and vulnerabilities and ensure that they are addressed.
Notes: New post

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Director responsible for managing Border Force critical incidents, seasonal relief workforce & development of the Operational Resources Model.

Name: N/D

Notes: New post. Team salary costs included with 2BF03

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Operational responsibility for border control operations (1350 staff) for all ports and airports in the region (Port of Felixstowe, Harwich International Port, Port of Tilbury, Thamesport, Purfleet, Sheerness, London City Airport, London Luton Airport, Stansted Airport, Norwich Airport, Birmingham International Airport, East Midlands Airport, Cardiff Airport, Cardiff Docks, Swansea Docks, Pembroke Dock, Port of Fishguard, Port of Holyhead) and postal operations at the offices of exchange at Mount Pleasant (Royal Mail) and Coventry International Hub (Parcelforce)'

Name: N/D

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The leadership and management of approximately 1150 staff and other resources across Border Force North Region to deliver key business results. The region covers 16 international airports and 12 major, (and countless smaller) seaports in Northern England, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Additionally the postholder has a national responsibility for the management of the Queens Warehouses (used to store seized goods pending court hearing or destruction)'

Name: Montgomery Charles
Job/Team Function: 'The Head of Border Force is responsible for the delivery of the strategic aims of Border Force; the strengthening of the UK’s security through strong border controls, protecting the country from illegal immigration, organised crime and terrorism, while welcoming and facilitating legitimate travellers and trade. Border Force will protect our border with single immigration and customs checks, tackle smuggling, immigration crime and border tax fraud, and it will implement fast and fair decisions. This will be accomplished by integrating the work of the legacy immigration and customs services, coupled with the use of technology to increase the level of data and intelligence support to frontline operations. We will work collaboratively to achieve this with our partners and develop our special relationships with HMRC, the Police, SOCA and other law enforcement agencies.'

The Areal Director also has responsibility for enhancing the regions profile, identity and culture. He acts as an ambassador for the region.

Name: Hugh Ind
Job/Team Function: Director of Compliance and Returns covering Interventions & Sanctions, Removals Integration Project, Returns, NRC and Removals Casework.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Director for Removals and Compliance Casework with responsibility for strengthening compliance amongst migrants by contacting those who may not have a right to be here and ensuring they either regularise their stay or leave the UK. Responsibility for management of a contract with Capita for contact management and casework. Those who will not depart voluntarily will be tasked onto ICE teams for enforced removal. Specific teams will focus on elements of this work - families, core casework, and compliance.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Returns is responsible for the holding individuals subject to detention under immigration legislation safely and securely, for enforcing their removal from the UK when the appropriate arrangements have been made, to ensure routes are maintained for removals, for the provision of electronic monitoring where it is made a requirement for those released on bail and for operating a programme to assist the departure of irregular migrants and failed asylum seekers who wish to leave the UK voluntarily.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Criminal Investigations and Central Operations
Job/Team Function: 'Home Office Criminal Investigation Teams are responsible for tackling immigration crime at the border and inland with a particular focus on organised immigration crime. They have a criminal and financial investigations capability, combining crime teams at the border and in regional offices across the UK using specially trained immigration officers, financial investigators and seconded police officers to disrupt organised criminal groups. By working in an integrated way with law enforcement agencies at home and abroad, particularly the National Crime Agency, Border Police Command, we will maximise our strengths and develop our capability to deal with the full range of immigration offences. Our priorities are to tackle all forms of human trafficking, facilitation and the production and supply of false or forged documentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the deportation of Foreign National Offenders from the United Kingdom.  The Directorate’s objective is to protect the public by deporting foreign nationals who commit serious criminal offences, where legislation permits, and to actively monitor and manage Foreign National Offenders (FNOs) released into the community pending deportation. It does this by rigorously pursuing deportation against foreign offenders who meet our criteria, managing each case through the legal process, negotiating barriers such as travel documents and ensuring that the use of immigration detention is appropriate. Asylum, remand; custody and non-detained teams provide specialist service to these key cohorts. A further 90 IE staff are embedded in prisons nationwide.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading a programme of work on removals integration. The work involves exploring new ways of working and alternative delivery models to increase capacity and capability and deliver efficiencies in the longer term.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the removal of cases detained by the Immigration Compliance & Enforcement Teams across the Country.
Notes: Post covered on a temporary basis

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Working with partners within the Home Office and other government departments, the Director of the Interventions and Sanctions Unit is responsible for the development and systematic application of a range of sanctions in order to deny access to public and financial services by those who are not entitled, thereby removing incentives for people to stay in the UK illegally and encouraging those who remain here unlawfully to regularise their stay or to depart voluntarily.

Name: David Wood
Job/Team Function: The Director of Crime and Intelligence has primary responsibility for frontline immigration intelligence, criminal investigation and criminal casework, including the deportation of foreign offenders ensuring that those who have no right to be in the UK do not remain

Name: Mike Anderson
Job Title: Director General, International and Immigration Policy Group
Job/Team Function: 'Strategy, Immigration and International Group gives policy advice on immigration and border policy, civil liberties and identity and sponsors the key agencies in the Home Office and NDPBs which safeguard and regulate personal information including the Identity and Passport Service and the Criminal Records Bureau. The Group leads on strategy development for the Department and coordinates across the Home Office on its international agenda. The Director General is a member of the Home Office Executive Management Board and Supervisory Board.'
Notes: Formerly 3SIIG01. Direct reports included in 2IIPG05 (200k).

Name: Tyson Hepple
Job/Team Function: 'Cross-Home Office responsibility for delivering our objective to Protect People's Freedoms and Civil Liberties and policy responsibility for key parts of the civil liberties and public protection agenda including but not limited to DNA retention; CCTV and the Automatic Number Plate Recognition System, Stop and Search. Also responsible for implementing the outcome of the review of the Vetting and Barring Scheme, the criminal records regime, for managing the extradition review and for the passage of the Rights and Freedoms Bill. The Directorate sponsors the Independent Police Complaints Commission; the Security Industry Authority; the Independent Safeguarding Authority; the Criminal Records Bureau.'
Notes: Formerly 2SIIG05. Included directs reports to 3IIPG01 (200k), 2IIPG09 (200k) and 2IIPG08 (100k).

The Directorate works closely with many Home Office units and agencies, and with other government departments and posts overseas to ensure that the Home Office’s international priorities are identified and coherently managed, negotiated and delivered.'

Name: Glyn Williams
Job Title: Director of Immigration and Border Policy Directorate
Job/Team Function: 'Provide effective policy advice to support the government’s objective of reducing net migration; Provide a strategic policy framework to protect the UK from illegal immigration, crime and terrorism, through effective end-to end border controls; Provide an effective set of policies that protect the public by removing illegal immigrants, deporting foreign national criminals and denying the privileges of British nationality to those who harm the UK; Support an effective asylum system, through effective policies, both in the UK and in Europe; Ensure we have a fit for purpose legal framework, and manage litigation effectively'
Notes: Formerly 2SIIG06

Name: Bernard Silverman
Job/Team Function: 'The task of the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA) is to provide independent scientific advice and support of the highest quality to the Home Secretary and other Home Office ministers and officials on the whole range of Home Office policy and operations. Home Office specialists in many scientific disciplines work under the CSA's leadership: physical scientists and engineers; economists, social researchers and operational researchers; statisticians; and veterinary, medical and biological scientists. The Home Office CSA also plays a key role across government, for example in the interdepartmental network of departmental Chief Scientific Advisers, chaired by the Government Chief Scientific Adviser.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job Title: Director for Social Science and Chief Economist
Job/Team Function: 'The Chief Economist provides impartial, high-quality economic advice to Ministers and senior officials across the full range of Home Office policy areas. Working in the Strategic Centre of the Home Office, he is directly supported by a team of economists and operational researchers (the Economics and Resource Analysis group, or ERA). As Director for Social Science he is responsible for ensuring that the analysis undertaken by Home Office economists, operational reasearchers and social researchers, many of whom are embedded in policy areas, is conducted to the highest professional standards and used appropriately.'

Name: Alan Pratt
Job Title: Director of Science Engineering and Technology
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Science, Engineering and Technology and Chief Operating Officer provides strategic oversight of all Home Office physical science and technology. They also have direct management responsibility for science delivery and regulation functions, including the Centre for Applied Science and Technology (CAST), National DNA Database Unit (NDNADU), Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU), HO Science Shared Support team and sponsors the Forensics and Surveillance Camera Regulator. As Head of Profession for scientists and engineers in the Home Office, they work across Government to ensure specialist scientific skills are developed and used effectively.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: The Economic and Resource Analysis (ERA) group provides objective, scientific advice to support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, largely through specialist Economists and Operational Researchers.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy and Ministerial support on the use of living animals in scientific procedures and for the operation of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) in England, Scotland and Wales. Acting on the advice of the animals (scientific procedures) inspectorate (ASPI), the ASPD licensing team grants, amends and revokes licences granted under ASPA. The ASPD policy team supports ministers by providing advice on specific issues, speeches, briefing for meetings and parliamentary debates, and draft responses to parliamentary questions. In addition, the policy team deals with correspondence from MPs and the public about animal experimentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Senior Biometrics Adviser provides advice to those projects and programmes in the Home Office, its agencies and law enforcement organisations which make use of biometrics for identity assurance, securing of borders and the prevention and the investigation of crime – from development of policy to procurement and deployment. The SBA offers independent assurance on programme feasibility, risk management and value for money. The Adviser leads on national and international standards within the Home Office, and is the interface to the supplier, integrator and academic communities, ensuring a coherent forward view on the application of biometrics in a privacy-respecting context.'
Notes: Team salary costs incorporated with 1HOS02

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Statistician and Head of Profession for Statistics
Job/Team Function: 'Home Office Statistics publish a wide range of statistical outputs to the highest professional standards which are free from political interference. The statistical teams work under the Chief Statistician who is also the Head of Profession for Statistics and he reports to the National Statistician with respect to all professional matters. The teams collect, process, analyse and publish a range of National Statistics and official statistics outputs. These support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, performance management, and meet the needs of Parliament and the wider public.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST)
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST) provides expert advice, innovation and frontline support for the Home Office and its agencies on any issue relating to science and technology. CAST supports the full range of Home Office priorities in the areas of policing and tackling crime, counter terrorism, border security and controlling immigration. CAST only operate where others cannot for reasons of impartiality, national security or market failure.'
Notes: Incorporates team salary costs from 1HOS06

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Animals in Science Regulation Unit
Job/Team Function: 'The Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU) comprises the policy, licensing and inspectorate staff responsible for administering the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) and related regulations.  The Policy Team advises ministers on issues related to ASPA and responds to correspondence (including PQs and FOI enquiries) from MPs and the public.  Inspectors (all registered medical or veterinary practitioners) provide advice on applications to the Licensing Team who grant the licences on behalf of the Secretary of State.  Inspectors also visit registered establishments to check for non-compliance and provide advice on applications and good practice. The majority of visits are unannounced.'
Notes: Incorporates team salary costs from EQV09

Name: Sir Charles Montgomery
Job/Team Function: 'The Head of Border Force is responsible for the delivery of the strategic aims of Border Force; the strengthening of the UK’s security through strong border controls, protecting the country from illegal immigration, organised crime and terrorism, while welcoming and facilitating legitimate travellers and trade. Border Force will protect our border with single immigration and customs checks, tackle smuggling, immigration crime and border tax fraud, and it will implement fast and fair decisions. This will be accomplished by integrating the work of the legacy immigration and customs services, coupled with the use of technology to increase the level of data and intelligence support to frontline operations. We will work collaboratively to achieve this with our partners and develop our special relationships with HMRC, the Police, SOCA and other law enforcement agencies.'

Name: Vacant
Job/Team Function: 'Director responsible for: the definition and delivery of the e-borders programme; the development of the Border Automation strategy, and; the commissioning of live technology services for Border Force'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the portfolio of e-Borders and Border Technology delivery projects, primarily associated with the Warnings Index or Semaphore systems'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Director responsible for the development of the Border Automation strategy, and the commissioning of live' technology services for Border Force

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: ' To effectively and efficiently manage all intelligence received, internally or externally, related to Border Force.

Name: Mandie Campbell
Job/Team Function: 'The Chief Operating Officer will be accountable to the Director General Border Force for the overall performance of the Border Force and will be responsible for ensuring achievement of the goals and outcomes agreed with Ministers'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for leading the National Operations and Performance command in Border Force, driving operational business performance across Border Force to shape and deliver organisational priorities and targets. Leading an effective prioritisation, tasking and deployment process nationally. Leading the development and establishment of an integrated national intelligence and targeting capability to support front line operational delivery. Developing and holding effective partnerships with HMRC, Police, SOCA, Counter Terrorism agencies and international partners to support wider border security activities and priorities.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The role is to lead and develop 1,500 staff working to secure the UK border in South, South West England .  The remit is to create a fully integrated; multi skilled and flexible workforce to ensure that only legitimate people and goods enter the UK.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Operational responsibility for border control operations (1350 staff) for all ports and airports in the region (Port of Felixstowe, Harwich International Port, Port of Tilbury, Thamesport, Purfleet, Sheerness, London City Airport, London Luton Airport, Stansted Airport, Norwich Airport, Birmingham International Airport, East Midlands Airport, Cardiff Airport, Cardiff Docks, Swansea Docks, Pembroke Dock, Port of Fishguard, Port of Holyhead) and postal operations at the offices of exchange at Mount Pleasant (Royal Mail) and Coventry International Hub (Parcelforce)'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The leadership and management of approximately 1150 staff and other resources across Border Force North Region to deliver key business results. The region covers 16 international airports and 12 major, (and countless smaller) seaports in Northern England, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Additionally the postholder has a national responsibility for the management of the Queens Warehouses (used to store seized goods pending court hearing or destruction)'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for Immigration and Customs border operations at London Heathrow, Farnborough, Northolt and RAF Brize Norton. Leadership of approximatley 1,700 staff and management of budget of £83m. Working with stakeholders at Heathrow to ensure the security and integrity of the border at Heathrow whilst maximising Customs revenue and facilitating honest travel and trade. Provide advice to Ministers and senior officials on border control and Customs operations.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Regional Director Border Force South East and Europe
Job/Team Function: The role is to lead and develop more than 1,000 staff working to secure the UK border in South, South East England and Juxtaposed Controls in Paris, Brussels & Norrthern France.  The remit is to create a fully integrated; multi skilled and flexible workforce to ensure that only legitimate people and goods enter the UK.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Director responsible for managing Border Force critical incidents, seasonal relief workforce & development of the Operational Resources Model.

Name: Julie Taylor
Job/Team Function: 'The Strategy & Change Director will drive the Transformation Programme, strengthening governance and strategy, building skills and capability and improving systems and processes . They will also have oversight of central services that support the regional operations to secure the UK borders. Central services comprises staff working in a wide range of functions including , operational policy and guidance, resources, business planning, HR & training transformation and transition. The Director will be responsible for overseeing all the workstreams within the Border Force’s ambitious change programme and for linking this to the wider Home Office corporate, to the related change programmes of the UK Border Agency and the National Crime Agency and to the Border Security Strategy'ons to secure the UK borders. Central services comprises staff working in a wide range of functions including major technology projects (e-borders), operational policy and guidance, resources, business planning, HR & training transformation and transition. The Director will be responsible for overseeing all the workstreams within the Border Force’s ambitious change programme and for linking this to the wider Home Office corporate, to the related change programmes of the UK Border Agency and the National Crime Agency and to the Border Security Strategy'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director Strategy, Customers, Communications & Operational Policy
Job/Team Function: 'The Transformation project is an ambitious change programme designed to create a Border Force equipped for the future, with a new intelligence model, a new operating model and the implementation of an automation strategy. The Head of Transformation will be accountable to the Director of Change and ultimately to the Director General Border Force for the design and delivery of the transformation project and will be responsible for ensuring achievement of the goals and outcomes agreed with Ministers'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Director responsible for leading the People Directorate and developing and implementing the workforce capability strategy.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To manage the fundemental revision to operational practices and procedures

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The main objective of the role is to oversee the transition of the Border Force from UL Border Agency to an operational command within the Home Office. This includes ensuring effective project management arrangements and the coherance of projects within the programme, and identifying success measures.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Director responsible in Border Force for the delivery of the following key support services; Financial Planing, Management and Support; Business  and  Workforce Planning; Communications; Learning & Development Strategy and Delivery; Border Force HR Transformation programmes; Assurance; HMRC systems and services. Also the co-ordination across Border Force of: Health & Safety; Risk Management; Security; Business Continuity; Equality and Diversity; Professionalism. The Management of the following national customer facing teams: Complaints; Official Correspondence; National Post Seizure Unit; Civil Penalty Central Administration Unit; Debt Costs Recovery Unit.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job Title: Director Border Force Transformation, Operations & Change
Job/Team Function: 'Takes a leading role within the Border Force business, and works in partnership with wider UKBA management teams and external stakeholders to: Develop the Border Force strategic vision; actively plan, co-ordinate and develop Border Force change portfolios and deliver new technology, organisational change and new business operating models at ports/airports to strengthen border security and facilitate legitimate travellers and businesses. Leads the negotiations with the TUS on workforce modernisation, including the introduction of new working patterns and grading model.'

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: “To ensure a successful UKBA contribution to the London 2012 Olympic Games, so as to enhance the reputation of the Agency both at home and abroad, with internal and external stakeholders. To assist the UK government to deliver a safe, secure and inspirational games through swift, safe and secure traveller and accreditation processes, in keeping with the Olympic spirit. As Senior Responsible Owner for UKBA Olympic 2012 programme, to build and develop a UKBA wide programme to develop a platform for an inspirational Games in London 2012.”

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: Leads the UKBA’s response to the challenges posed by the London Olympics and Paralympics Games in the summer of 2012. Responsible for leading and managing the central programme team to identify and manage the individual projects required to plan and deliver the Agency’s operational response to the Games, prior to arrival at the border and in Country. Additionally, responsible for leading the Accreditation project to perform the background checks on 500,000 UK/ EEA and non EEA nationals on behalf of the Agency and the Home Office.

Name: Simon Wren
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Communications leads the delivery of external and internal communications for the Home Office, working with the Secretary of State, Ministers and senior officials to provide leadership and advice on communications to support policy and departmental objectives. The directorate is responsible for providing specialist services in media handling, strategic communications/marketing, digital, internal communications, insight/research and a correspondence service for the public and MPs.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Head of News is responsible for all press and media handling activities within the Home Office and acts as the spokesperson for the Home Secretary. Leading the Press Office, the Head of News helps to develop and deliver effective media handling strategies and support to Ministers and policy teams. The Press Office are responsible for both reactive and proactive media handling strategies.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Strategic Communications, Marketing and Insight
Job/Team Function: 'The Strategic Communication, Marketing and Insight Unit leads on Home Office communication strategy by setting out communication objectives and priorities for the Department and measuring progress against them. The unit also undertakes communications research and analysis. This enables it to design and implement campaigns which help the Department deliver its objectives by changing attitudes and behaviour. '
Notes: Providing maternity leave cover

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Digital, Events and Staff Communications
Job/Team Function: 'The Digital, Events and Staff Communications Unit manages and maintains Home Office corporate communications channels, including the external facing corporate website and relevant content for the Direct Gov website. The unit is also responsible for internal news and staff engagement, visits, events and digital communications (internet and intranet).'

Name: Peter Kane
Job Title: Director General, Finance and Corporate Services
Job/Team Function: The Director General of the Finance and Corporate Services Group is a member of the Home Office Board and is responsible for the financial strategy, financial management and financial reporting for the Home Office. In addition, the Director General leads the Home Office commercial, information technology, information management and estates strategies, and professional services. The Finance and Corporate Services Group provides high quality, cost-effective corporate services to enable ministers, the department and key stakeholders to deliver for the public. These services also include internal audit, business planning, performance and risk management and achieving value for money.'
Notes: Includes salary costs for 2FC03, 2FC01, 2FC07, 2FC09 and Head of Commercial - Strategy, Intelligence and Performance

Name: Ilona Blue
Job/Team Function: The Performance and Finance Directorate provides cost effective financial and performance advice and support to Ministers, the Department and key stakeholders to enable them to deliver the Home Office objectives.  It aims to maximise our 'added value', minimise demands on our businesses, improve financial processes and systems, drive out inefficiencies and support the delivery of all departmental objectives.'
Notes: Salary costs included with 3FC01

Name: N/D'
Job Title: Head of Value for Money Unit
Job/Team Function: The Value for Money Unit is part of the Home Office's central finance and performance function. Its role is to support the development and delivery of ambitious plans for increasing Value for Money (VFM), strengthening performance and reducing costs across the breadth of the Department's responsibilities, with a focus on achieving substantial gains through reforming and streamlining business processes. On behalf of the Accounting Officer, the Unit leads the Home Office's relationship with the Public Accounts Committee and the National Audit Office on VFM matters.

Name: N/D'
Job Title: Head of Resources and Planning Unit
Job/Team Function: 'The Resources and Planning Unit is responsible for securing the forward finances of the Home Office, ensuring those resources are applied to ministerial priorities, and supporting the delivery of the performance outcomes to which the Department is committed, whilst spotting and managing any emerging risks.'

Name: N/D'
Job Title: Head of Accounting and Finance Unit
Job/Team Function: The Accounting & Finance Unit supports the Accounting Officer, champions good governance, provides assurance to the Executive Management Board, the Supervisory Board, HM Treasury and the public that Home Office money is managed effectively. This function is achieved through the provision of relevant, reliable and timely financial data to inform decision making and the provision of advice and support in the application of financial policies.

Name: N/D'
Job/Team Function: The Internal Audit Unit provides an independent evaluation of, and contributes to, improvements in governance, risk management and control processes to help the Home Office group achieve its aims and objectives, in line with Public Sector Internal Audit standards.'

Name: N/D'

The Unit is responsible for developing and securing cabinet and parliamentary clearance of the immigration and visa fees package. In addition it manages European grant funding and provides effective control of asylum support expenditure.

The services provided include: secure system hosting, system administration, operation, maintenance and software development.

Name: David Wood
Job/Team Function: 'The Director General is accountable to the Permanent Secretary. Immigration Enforcement is responsible for preventing abuse, pursuing immigration offenders and increasing compliance with immigration law. It works with partners to regulate migration in line with the law and government policy and supports economic growth. Immigration Enforcement’s strategic objectives are to: • Remove incentives for people to stay in the UK illegally. • Target the criminality that supports illegal immigration. • Effectively manage high harm individuals to reduce risk to the public. • Continue to increase the number of individuals we remove from the UK.'
Notes: Temporary appointment

Name: Tony Eastaugh
Job/Team Function: 'Working in close collaboration with a range of partners across the Home Office and other agencies, this role will ensure the delivery of the Agency’s overarching enforcement strategy of which more enforcement action against overstayers and foreign national offenders is key.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director for the London and South of England
Job/Team Function: 'Area Director for the London and South of England responsible for the delivery of enforcement activity and performance within the region; Delivering the regional business plan; leadership of and responsibility for immigration compliance & enforcement teams (ICEs) across the command; Developing and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external corporate partners; Leading the command to support the reform of central processing functions in accordance with the Immigration Enforcement Operating Model. The Area Director also has responsibility for enhancing the regions profile, identity and culture. He acts as an ambassador for the region.'
Unit: London South East and South Region

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Director for Scotland and Northern Ireland is responsible for managing immigration enforcement activity in Scotland & Northern Ireland in cooperation with other law enforcement agencies and for the coordination of all Home Office activity in Scotland and Northern Ireland. The postholder is also responsible for advising on devolution issues and maintaining relations with the Scottish and Northern Ireland Assembly Governments. The postholder is the Senior Responsible Owner for immigration related engagement in the Glasgow Commonwealth Games 2014.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the Enforcement Improvement Plan which, working with 2UKBA20, is responsible for Enforcement and the Regions, sets out a clear programme of activity to transform the operating model for enforcement within the Agency. This includes an assurance strategy to ensure compliance with rules and guidance, a new performance management framework which will hold operational managers to account, professionalising our workforce, including simplifying all enforcement guidance, and also our future capability, which includes establishing a UKBA and Border Force Training Academy which will deliver a professional, consistent and accredited training programme for operational staff.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Area Director for the North, Midlands and Wales responsible for the delivery of enforcement activity and performance within the region; Delivering the regional business plan; leadership of and responsibility for immigration compliance & enforcement teams (ICEs) across the command; Developing and maintaining strong relationships with internal and external corporate partners; Leading the command to support the reform of central processing functions in accordance with the Immigration Enforcement Operating Model. The Area Director also has responsibility for enhancing the regions profile, identity and culture. He acts as an ambassador for the region.

Name: Hugh Ind
Job/Team Function: The Director for Compliance and Returns has responsibility for removals casework including the Capita contract and management of the Migration Refusal Pool; for ensuring illegal migrants are denied the privileges of living in the UK; the deportation of Foreign National Offenders; and has oversight of the detention estate and escorted and voluntary returns.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Director for Removals and Compliance Casework with responsibility for strengthening compliance amongst migrants by contacting those who may not have a right to be here and ensuring they either regularise their stay or leave the UK. Responsibility for management of a contract with Capita for contact management and casework. Those who will not depart voluntarily will be tasked onto ICE teams for enforced removal. Specific teams will focus on elements of this work - families, core casework, and compliance.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Returns is responsible for the holding individuals subject to detention under immigration legislation safely and securely, for enforcing their removal from the UK when the appropriate arrangements have been made, to ensure routes are maintained for removals, for the provision of electronic monitoring where it is made a requirement for those released on bail and for operating a programme to assist the departure of irregular migrants and failed asylum seekers who wish to leave the UK voluntarily.'

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: 'Leads and directs development and delivery of policy, casework and operational activity of the Special Cases Directorate; removal and exclusion from the UK and deny British citizenship to individuals linked to terrorism and serious organised crime; and upholds the UK’s policy of denying safe haven to war criminals or those who commit crimes against humanity.'
Notes: Post transferred to the Office for Security and Counter Terrorism (OSCT)

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the deportation of Foreign National Offenders from the United Kingdom.  The Directorate’s objective is to protect the public by deporting foreign nationals who commit serious criminal offences, where legislation permits, and to actively monitor and manage Foreign National Offenders (FNOs) released into the community pending deportation. It does this by rigorously pursuing deportation against foreign offenders who meet our criteria, managing each case through the legal process, negotiating barriers such as travel documents and ensuring that the use of immigration detention is appropriate. Asylum, remand; custody and non-detained teams provide specialist service to these key cohorts. A further 90 UK Border Agency staff are embedded in prisons nationwide.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading a programme of work on removals integration. The work involves exploring new ways of working and alternative delivery models to increase capacity and capability and deliver efficiencies in the longer term.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the removal of cases detained by the Immigration Compliance & Enforcement Teams across the Country.
Notes: Temporary appointment

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Working with partners within the Home Office and other government departments, the Director of the Interventions and Sanctions Unit is responsible for the development and systematic application of a range of sanctions in order to deny access to public and financial services by those who are not entitled, thereby removing incentives for people to stay in the UK illegally and encouraging those who remain here unlawfully to regularise their stay or to depart voluntarily.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Home Office Criminal Investigation Teams are responsible for tackling immigration crime at the border and inland with a particular focus on organised immigration crime. They have a criminal and financial investigations capability, combining crime teams at the border and in regional offices across the UK using specially trained immigration officers, financial investigators and seconded police officers to disrupt organised criminal groups. By working in an integrated way with law enforcement agencies at home and abroad, particularly the National Crime Agency, Border Police Command, we will maximise our strengths and develop our capability to deal with the full range of immigration offences. Our priorities are to tackle all forms of human trafficking, facilitation and the production and supply of false or forged documentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for professional standards of operational intelligence in UKBA; intelligence policy, guidance, compliance and provision of intelligence training; liaison with UK law enforcement; advice on document fraud and forgery trends, in-depth forensic examination of suspect documents and provision of document fraud and forgery training.'
Notes: Includes staff costs for the Africa and Gulf sections

Name: Bernard Silverman
Job/Team Function: 'The task of the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA) is to provide independent scientific advice and support of the highest quality to the Home Secretary and other Home Office ministers and officials on the whole range of Home Office policy and operations. Home Office specialists in many scientific disciplines work under the CSA's leadership: physical scientists and engineers; economists, social researchers and operational researchers; statisticians; and veterinary, medical and biological scientists. The Home Office CSA also plays a key role across government, for example in the interdepartmental network of departmental Chief Scientific Advisers, chaired by the Government Chief Scientific Adviser.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job Title: Director for Social Science and Chief Economist
Job/Team Function: 'The Chief Economist provides impartial, high-quality economic advice to Ministers and senior officials across the full range of Home Office policy areas. Working in the Strategic Centre of the Home Office, he is directly supported by a team of economists and operational researchers (the Economics and Resource Analysis group, or ERA). As Director for Social Science he is responsible for ensuring that the analysis undertaken by Home Office economists, operational reasearchers and social researchers, many of whom are embedded in policy areas, is conducted to the highest professional standards and used appropriately.'

Name: Alan Pratt
Job Title: Director of Science Engineering and Technology
Job/Team Function: 'The Director of Science, Engineering and Technology and Chief Operating Officer provides strategic oversight of all Home Office physical science and technology. They also have direct management responsibility for science delivery and regulation functions, including the Centre for Applied Science and Technology (CAST), National DNA Database Unit (NDNADU), Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU), HO Science Shared Support team and sponsors the Forensics and Surveillance Camera Regulator. As Head of Profession for scientists and engineers in the Home Office, they work across Government to ensure specialist scientific skills are developed and used effectively.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: The Economic and Resource Analysis (ERA) group provides objective, scientific advice to support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, largely through specialist Economists and Operational Researchers.'

Name: 'Eliminated'
Job/Team Function: Responsible for policy and Ministerial support on the use of living animals in scientific procedures and for the operation of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) in England, Scotland and Wales. Acting on the advice of the animals (scientific procedures) inspectorate (ASPI), the ASPD licensing team grants, amends and revokes licences granted under ASPA. The ASPD policy team supports ministers by providing advice on specific issues, speeches, briefing for meetings and parliamentary debates, and draft responses to parliamentary questions. In addition, the policy team deals with correspondence from MPs and the public about animal experimentation.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Senior Biometrics Adviser provides advice to those projects and programmes in the Home Office, its agencies and law enforcement organisations which make use of biometrics for identity assurance, securing of borders and the prevention and the investigation of crime – from development of policy to procurement and deployment. The SBA offers independent assurance on programme feasibility, risk management and value for money. The Adviser leads on national and international standards within the Home Office, and is the interface to the supplier, integrator and academic communities, ensuring a coherent forward view on the application of biometrics in a privacy-respecting context.'
Notes: Team salary costs incorporated with 1HOS02

Name: N/D
Job Title: Chief Statistician and Head of Profession for Statistics
Job/Team Function: 'Home Office Statistics publish a wide range of statistical outputs to the highest professional standards which are free from political interference. The statistical teams work under the Chief Statistician who is also the Head of Profession for Statistics and he reports to the National Statistician with respect to all professional matters. The teams collect, process, analyse and publish a range of National Statistics and official statistics outputs. These support executive decision making in policy, strategic planning and delivery, performance management, and meet the needs of Parliament and the wider public.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Director, Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST)
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Applied Science & Technology (CAST) provides expert advice, innovation and frontline support for the Home Office and its agencies on any issue relating to science and technology. CAST supports the full range of Home Office priorities in the areas of policing and tackling crime, counter terrorism, border security and controlling immigration. CAST only operate where others cannot for reasons of impartiality, national security or market failure.'
Notes: Incorporates team salary costs from 1HOS06

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Animals in Science Regulation Unit
Job/Team Function: 'The Animals in Science Regulation Unit (ASRU) comprises the policy, licensing and inspectorate staff responsible for administering the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA) and related regulations.  The Policy Team advises ministers on issues related to ASPA and responds to correspondence (including PQs and FOI enquiries) from MPs and the public.  Inspectors (all registered medical or veterinary practitioners) provide advice on applications to the Licensing Team who grant the licences on behalf of the Secretary of State.  Inspectors also visit registered establishments to check for non-compliance and provide advice on applications and good practice. The majority of visits are unannounced.'
Notes: Incorporates team salary costs from EQV09

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Developments in the forensic science market since 2005 have aimed to create a fully functioning market with the right services, at the right price, delivered to the appropriate standard. To achieve this it is essential to ensure that the integrity of, and confidence in, the criminal justice system (CJS) is maintained, that a level playing field exists for all suppliers (which includes the police and the commercial providers), and that quality standards are maintained in the face of the commercial market, increased competition and in-house work by the police and other law enforcement bodies; setting and monitoring the quality standards is the role of the Forensic Science Regulator (as a non-statutory function) who has also taken on the additional role of Surveillance Camera Commissioner. The Surveillance Camera Commissioner role includes statutory functions that are set out in the Protection of Freedoms Act 2012 to encourage compliance with a code of practice, monitor its operation and impact, and provide advice about it to interested parties. The roles overlap in the increasing use of forensic processes for surveillance images. The Surveillance Camera Commissioner is required to report annually to the Home Secretary, who in turn must lay that report before Parliament.'
Notes: This post is directly appointed by the Home Secretary and is not a Civil Servant. Team salary costs incorporated with 2HOS02

Name: Sir Charles Montgomery
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for the delivery of the strategic aims of Border Force; the strengthening of the UK’s security through strong border controls, protecting the country from illegal immigration, organised crime and terrorism, while welcoming and facilitating legitimate travellers and trade. Border Force will protect our border with single immigration and customs checks, tackle smuggling, immigration crime and border tax fraud, and it will implement fast and fair decisions. This will be accomplished by integrating the work of the legacy immigration and customs services, coupled with the use of technology to increase the level of data and intelligence support to frontline operations. We will work collaboratively to achieve this with our partners and develop our special relationships with HMRC, the Police, SOCA and other law enforcement agencies.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The role is to lead and develop 1,500 staff working to secure the UK border in South, South West England .  The remit is to create a fully integrated; multi skilled and flexible workforce to ensure that only legitimate people and goods enter the UK.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Director responsible in Border Force for the delivery of the following key support services; Financial Planing, Management and Support; Business  and  Workforce Planning; Communications; Learning & Development Strategy and Delivery; Border Force HR Transformation programmes; Assurance; HMRC systems and services. Also the co-ordination across Border Force of: Health & Safety; Risk Management; Security; Business Continuity; Equality and Diversity; Professionalism. The Management of the following national customer facing teams: Complaints; Official Correspondence; National Post Seizure Unit; Civil Penalty Central Administration Unit; Debt Costs Recovery Unit.'

Leads the negotiations with the TUS on workforce modernisation, including the introduction of new working patterns and grading model.'

The Secretary organises meetings of the Branch Executive Committee and issues communications to Branch members keeping them informed of developments affecting their terms and conditions and seeking their views on developments to inform consultation and negotiation with Home Office management. With the FDA National Officer the Branch Secretary is responsible for negotiating pay for FDA members at grades below the SCS.'
Notes: Team salary costs incorporated with 2HR02.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Organisation Development and Design is a new Civil Service HR expert service which will provide a consistent cross-Government organisation development, design and change consultancy service to support Civil Service change and reform. The service is hosted by the Home Office and sits alongside Civil Service Learning as a resource.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'This role is responsible for delivering a first class HR service to customers by managing the intelligent customer relationship between the Civil Service HR Shared Expert Services for Policy and Resourcing; MOJ Shared Services for HR and Payroll; and other third party delivery partners and business customers. It ensures that Home Office requirements influence service development and system specification and that products and outcomes are successfully implemented in the organisation.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director Reward and Employee Relations
Job/Team Function: 'The purpose of this role is to ensure that the department adheres to employment law and safeguards the health, safety and wellbeing of its staff; to defend the department against employment tribunal and PI claims and to manage staff reward solutions.'

Name: Martin Beecroft
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for strategic direction of the people strategies for UKBA and Border Force - including supporting the transformation of both organisations - and for leadership of key Home Office wide deliverables, as well as for developing and implementing the Home Office people strategy.'
Notes: This post transferred to the Home Office in July 2012 following a restructure. Team salary costs incorporated with 2HR02.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Organisational Development and Design Expert Service
Job/Team Function: 'Civil Service HR has established its fourth expert service, specialising in Organisation Development and Design. The aim of this service is to provide a consistent cross-Government organisation development consultancy service to support Civil Service change and reform. The service is also required to provide OD capability building for HR practitioners. The service is hosted by the Home Office.'
Notes: Currently being filled on a temporary basis.

Name: N/D
Job Title: Deputy Director, Organisational Development and Design Expert Service
Job/Team Function: 'Civil Service HR has established its fourth expert service, specialising in Organisation Development and Design. The aim of this service is to provide a consistent cross-Government organisation development consultancy service to support Civil Service change and reform. The service is also required to provide OD capability building for HR practitioners. The service is hosted by the Home Office.'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for leading a project to establish a common and integrated approach to the development of management information (MI) products and workforce plans across the Home Office. The post holder is also responsible for the key functions of PQs and FOIs and the Honours Secretariat.
Unit: Workforce Planning & Next Generation HR Team
Notes: Temporary post.

Notes: Team salary costs amalgamated with 2LAB01

Name: Harry Carter
Job/Team Function: 'This post supervises the teams advising OSCT, CPG, IPS and on commercial and employment law.'
Notes: Team salary costs amalgamated with 2LAB01

Name: Steven Bramley
Job/Team Function: 'This post supervises the three teams advising the UK Borders Agency, the EU and International team and a management support unit. The post holder is also the Principal Legal Adviser to the Northern Ireland Office.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adviser - UKBA Asylum and Appeals & Managed Migration
Job/Team Function: 'The immigration and international team advises on asylum, managed migrations and appeals.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adv - Security, International and Organised Crime
Job/Team Function: 'This team advises The Office for Security and Counter-Terrorism, as well as on organised crime and asset recovery under the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adviser - Head of Northern Ireland and Identity Team
Job/Team Function: 'This team advises the Northern Ireland Office on a variety of constitutional matters and IPS, in particular the General Registry Office, and undertakes other corporate tasks including co-ordinating the Home Office's Human Rights work''

Name: Eliminated
Job/Team Function: 'The team advises on the introduction of the ID card scheme as well as on a number of cross-cutting issues affecting the Home Office, such as information law matters. It also advises the General Register Office which deals with the registration of births, deaths and marriages in England and Wales.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adviser - Commercial and Employment
Job/Team Function: 'In this team, the commercial lawyers advise on a range of contracts from multi-million pound contracts to day to- day procurement tenders.The employment lawyers advise on issues such as the HM Revenue and Customs and UK Border Agency merger, discrimination in the workplace, TUPE principles and general human resources issues.'

Name: ND
Job/Team Function: 'The specialist EU team advises operational and policy units within the Home Office on issues such as the free movement and residence of EU nationals.The team also advises on extradition and mutual legal assistance.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adviser - Policing and Crime Reduction
Job/Team Function: 'The policing and crime reduction team advises on a wide range of policy areas from sex offenders, drugs and ASBOs through to police powers, alcohol and the retention of DNA samples by the police.'

Name: ND
Job Title: Assistant Legal Adviser - UK Border Agency (Borders and Enforcement)
Job/Team Function: 'The borders and enforcement team advises on UK Border Agency powers to regulate entry to the UK, on nationality and on deportations and removals from the UK.'

Name: Mike Anderson
Job Title: Director General Strategy, Immigration & International Group
Job/Team Function: 'Strategy, Immigration and International Group gives policy advice on immigration and border policy, civil liberties and identity and sponsors the key agencies in the Home Office and NDPBs which safeguard and regulate personal information including the Identity and Passport Service and the Criminal Records Bureau. The Group leads on strategy development for the Department and coordinates across the Home Office on its international agenda. The Director General is a member of the Home Office Executive Management Board and Supervisory Board.'

Name: Tyson Hepple
Job Title: Director Civil Liberties and Public Protection
Job/Team Function: 'Cross-Home Office responsibility for delivering our objective to Protect People's Freedoms and Civil Liberties and policy responsibility for key parts of the civil liberties and public protection agenda including but not limited to DNA retention; CCTV and the Automatic Number Plate Recognition System, Stop and Search. Also responsible for implementing the outcome of the review of the Vetting and Barring Scheme, the criminal records regime, for managing the extradition review and for the passage of the Rights and Freedoms Bill. The Directorate sponsors the Independent Police Complaints Commission; the Security Industry Authority; the Independent Safeguarding Authority; the Criminal Records Bureau.'

Name: Peter Storr
Job/Team Function: 'The International Director heads the Directorate which delivers the European Union and wider international aspects of Home Office priorities, with its international partners. The Directorate works closely with many Home Office units and agencies, and with other government departments and posts overseas to ensure that the Home Office’s international priorities are identified and coherently managed, negotiated and delivered.'

Name: Phil Duffy
Job Title: Director of Immigration and Border Policy Directorate
Job/Team Function: 'Provide effective policy advice to support the government’s objective of reducing net migration; Provide a strategic policy framework to protect the UK from illegal immigration, crime and terrorism, through effective end-to end border controls; Provide an effective set of policies that protect the public by removing illegal immigrants, deporting foreign national criminals and denying the privileges of British nationality to those who harm the UK; Support an effective asylum system, through effective policies, both in the UK and in Europe; Ensure we have a fit for purpose legal framework, and manage litigation effectively'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The Judicial Cooperation unit is responsible for extradition policy and casework and for overseeing the review of our extradition obligations. The UK Central Authority within JCU is responsible of administering the UK’s obligations under the current Mutual Legal Assistance scheme and negotiating the European Investigation Order.'

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Safeguarding and Public Protection Unit
Job/Team Function: 'The Safeguarding and Public Protection Unit is responsible for the reviews of the vetting and barring scheme and the criminal records regime and for delivering the outcomes of those reviews. The Unit leads for the Home Office on child safeguarding and missing persons and is responsible for implementing the Magee and Bichard agendas in relation to criminality information. The unit sponsors the Security Industry Authority, the Criminal Records Bureau, and the Independent Safeguarding Authority.'
Notes: Team salary costs incorporated with 2SIIG15.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: “The Deputy International Director supports the International Director in the work set out in 2SIG04 and ensures that the Home Office business areas understand the European Union procedures, negotiations on draft European legislation, international obligations and opportunities for delivering the Government’s international justice and home affairs (JHA) agenda.”

Name: N/D
Job Title: Head of Asylum, Criminality and Enforcement
Job/Team Function: 'Leads on Asylum policy. Brings together work on criminality, foreign prisoners, and how the Home Office and its partners should enforce immigration law and remove those with no right to remain in the United Kingdom'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Responsible for ensuring that our end-to-end checks on arrivals effectively tackle the threats facing the United Kingdom. Policy work on key enabling programmes, such as Advance Passenger Information and Passenger Name Records'
Notes: Post being covered on a temporary basis.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Covers policy on all migration routes including visitors, temporary migration (work, study) and permanent migration (family). Sets the framework of rules on permission to enter and stay. Current focus is on delivering the programme to reduce net migration'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'The MAC secretariat supports the MAC in providing independent and evidence-based advice to the Government on matters relating to migration, including on migration impacts, labour market shortages and limits on tiers 1 and 2 of the Points Based System'

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: 'Managing legal risk through the Litigation Strategy Board; co-ordinating changes to legislation; litigation policy, including legal aid and appeals, and relationship with higher courts'
Notes: Team salary costs incorporated into 2SIIG06

Notes: Team salary costs incorporated with 1SIIG11

Name: N/D
Job Title: Programme Director Schengen Information System II (SIS II)
Job/Team Function: The Schengen Information System II (SIS II) is a governmental database used by European countries to maintain and distribute information on individuals and pieces of property of interest. The intended uses of this system are for national security, border control and law enforcement purposes. A second technical version of this system, SIS II, is currently under development for 2013, under the responsibility of the European Commission.
Notes: New post from NPIA following restructure in October 2012.
